meanings.definition: To turn on or as if on a pivot.
meanings.sent1: She pivoted on her toes to face the door.
meanings.sent2: The door pivoted smoothly on its hinges.
meanings.sent3: The cat pivoted around the room chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: His decision pivoted on the outcome of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The dancer pivoted gracefully across the stage.

meanings.definition: To depend for support or turning on a point.
meanings.sent1: The success of the project pivoted on her approval.
meanings.sent2: The shelf pivoted on a single screw in the wall.
meanings.sent3: The plan pivoted on a last-minute change in schedule.
meanings.sent4: Her mood pivoted on the weather forecast for the weekend.
meanings.sent5: The entire strategy pivoted on securing the key partnership.
